author: Irina Anghel
description: Fewer wealthy Britons regret their decision to back Prime Minister Keir Starmer at last year’s general election, according to a new survey suggesting that well-off voters are coming to terms with the Labour government’s tax rises.
title: Starmer is Winning Back Britain’s Wealthy Voters, Survey Finds

author: Nick Wadhams, Magdalena Del Valle
description: President Donald Trump alleged he was the victim of “triple sabotage” after mishaps involving an escalator, a teleprompter and the sound system at the UN — problems that the world body blamed partly on his own team.
title: Trump Fuels Escalator Conspiracy With Claim of UN ‘Sabotage’

author: Erik Wasson, Mario Parker
description: Top House Democrat Hakeem Jeffries said he’s confident that a push by Republicans to redraw congressional districts nationwide will fail to give the GOP a decisive advantage in next year’s midterm elections.
title: Top House Democrat Is Confident of GOP Redistricting Push Failure

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Sam Dagher
description: Syria’s president made his debut on the international stage with the first address by a leader from his country to the United Nations General Assembly in more than half a century.
title: At the UN, Syria’s Leader Calls For International Help to Rebuild Shattered Nation

author: Ken Tran
description: House Republicans’ decision to recess days before federal funding lapses means they will “publicly” own a government shutdown, House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) said.
title: GOP ‘Irresponsible’ to Recess Ahead of Shutdown, Jeffries Says

author: Vinicius Andrade, Nicolle Yapur
description: Speculators seeking to profit from the selloffs racing through Argentina’s markets were stopped dead in their tracks by a powerful investor willing to take the opposite side of the trade: The US government.
title: Bessent Halts Argentina Crisis as US Lifeline Upends Short Bets

author: Ari Natter
description: The Trump administration plans to continue using emergency authority to stop coal-fired power plants from retiring, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Plans to Use Emergency Powers to Stop More Coal Closures

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Shery Ahn, Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s investment projects in the US will remain in limbo until visa issues are resolved, the nation’s prime minister said, urging Washington to act quickly to reassure Koreans concerned about getting detained for working there.
title: South Korea Says US Projects Will Remain in Limbo Until Visa Fix

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: US envoy Steve Witkoff predicted a breakthrough in the Israel-Hamas conflict in the coming days after President Donald Trump presented a 21-point plan to regional leaders in a meeting in New York this week.
title: Witkoff Predicts Gaza Peace Breakthrough After Trump Meeting

author: Emily Birnbaum, Dawn Lim
description: The nation’s largest business lobby is soliciting support from its members for a lawsuit against the Trump administration over its changes to the visa system for skilled foreign workers, setting up a potentially rancorous battle between corporate America and the president.
title: US Chamber Tests Members’ Will to Fight Trump on H-1B Visas

description: Colin Firth's ex-wife has said she is returning her honorary MBE in response to Donald Trump's state visit to the UK.
title: Colin Firth's Ex-Wife Says She Is Returning Honorary MBE Over Trump State Visit

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Warring parties in Sudan are nearing direct talks to end one of the world’s worst humanitarian crises, according to Massad Boulos, President Donald Trump’s senior advisor for Africa.
title: Sudan’s Warring Parties Near Talks, Top Trump Africa Aide Says

author: Augusta Saraiva, Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is on a winning streak, and he has Donald Trump largely to thank.
title: Lula Concludes New York Trip Riding High After Trump Shout-Out

author: Lucy White
description: Efforts to revive a long-anticipated high-speed rail project in the north of England could face further delays, according to a person familiar with the matter, as the Treasury seeks more time to weigh the costs.
title: UK Plans to Revive North England Rail Project Face Fresh Delays

author: Catherine Lucey
description: White House deputy chief of staff Taylor Budowich plans to leave his post at the end of the month to return to the private sector, an administration official said.
title: Longtime Trump Aide Taylor Budowich to Leave White House Post

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration launched investigations into imports of robotics, industrial machinery and medical devices, setting the stage for fresh duties as President Donald Trump moves to expand his tariff regime.
title: US Sets Stage for Tariffs on Robotics, Medical Devices

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the president’s interest in Latin America. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Keeps Close Tabs on Latin American Friends and Foes

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights said his agency has had to scale back its work given the financial crisis at the international peacekeeping body.
title: UN Human Rights Chief Laments Lower Standards Amid Funds Crisis

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: The Trump administration will soon provide additional financial aid to American farmers, with Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins saying an announcement could come “perhaps in the next couple of weeks.”
title: US Eyes Announcement of Farmer Relief Package in Coming Weeks

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Milda Seputyte
description: Turkey has deployed an advanced AWACS radar plane to Lithuania, signaling NATO is stepping up defenses in the Baltic region after Russian violations of its airspace.
title: Turkey Sends AWACS Radar Jet to Lithuania After Russia Incursion

author: Rodrigo Orihuela, Daniel Basteiro
description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said he’ll run for re-election in 2027, despite polls that show his Socialist party would have a difficult time winning a majority in parliament.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Says He Plans to Run for Re-Election in 2027

author: John Tozzi, Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Pharmacy middlemen are working on a proposal to voluntarily change some of their business practices in an effort to avoid new regulation from the Trump administration, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: Drug Middlemen Seek to Head Off New Rules With Voluntary Changes

author: Myles Miller
description: The US Secret Service investigation into a suspicious network of communication devices in the New York City area came after threatening phone calls were made to two White House aides and a top law enforcement official, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Threats to Trump Aides Sparked Secret Service SIM Card Probe

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: The top Senate Democrat with oversight of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac pressed Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent for more details about the Trump administration’s efforts to take the mortgage giants public.
title: Elizabeth Warren Presses Bessent on Fannie, Freddie IPO Efforts

author: Frank Jomo
description: Peter Mutharika was declared the winner of Malawi’s presidential elections, reinstating him as leader five years after he left office amid widespread public anger over high levels of corruption and the government’s management of the economy.
title: Octogenarian Ex-President Returns to Power in Malawian Election

author: Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump’s renovations to the White House — adding gold trim to the Oval Office interiors and new paving stones in the Rose Garden — have largely catered to aesthetic sensibilities he cultivated as he renovated Mar-a-Lago and built his namesake Manhattan tower. But his latest tweak to 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue appears to be less about decorating and more about trolling his predecessor.
title: Trump ‘Walk of Fame’ Mocks Biden With Portrait of Autopen

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Italy’s Court of Auditors has asked Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s government to provide more information on the plan to build a €13.5 billion ($15.8 billion) bridge linking Sicily to the mainland.
title: Italy Court Queries Government Plan to Build $16 Billion Bridge

author: Patricia Hurtado
description: The federal judge presiding over Luigi Mangione’s death penalty case warned Justice Department officials to stop making statements that link him to “left-wing” extremism, saying there could be punishments for future comments.
title: Luigi Mangione Judge Threatens Justice Department Over Comments

author: Thomas Buckley
description: Actress Jessica Chastain said in an Instagram post that she disagreed with Apple Inc.’s decision to pause the release of her series The Savant on its flagship Apple TV+ streaming platform.
title: Chastain Protests Apple TV+ Pausing Show Amid Political Risk

author: Arne Delfs, Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Swiss Economy Minister Guy Parmelin has taken over trade talks with the US, according to President Karin Keller-Sutter.
title: Swiss-US Tariff Talks Now Helmed by Parmelin, Keller-Sutter Says

author: Richard Bravo
description: European Parliament President Roberta Metsola said she expects the bloc’s lawmakers to give their blessing to a political deal struck with Washington that puts a 15% tariff on nearly all EU exports to the US.
title: EU Parliament Chief Expects Lawmakers to Approve US Trade Deal

author: Molly Schuetz
description: Jimmy Kimmel’s return to network TV is sparking reaction across the political spectrum, exposing the same ideological differences that his remarks about assassinated activist Charlie Kirk bared last week.
title: Kimmel Reactions Span the Same Deep Political Divide He Exposed

author: Georgia Hall, Max Rivera
description: The Trump administration’s steep new visa fees for highly specialized H-1B work visas have rattled US businesses, but most big companies are staying quiet as they wait to see how the policy plays out.
title: Rattled by Trump's Chaotic H-1B Policy, US Firms Quietly Wait Out Changes

author: Josh Wingrove, Alberto Nardelli
description: The US lowered tariffs on auto imports from the European Union to 15% retroactive to Aug. 1, cementing terms of the framework trade agreement the two sides struck almost two months ago.
title: US Cuts Tariffs on EU Cars to 15%, Cementing Trade Terms

author: Ellen Milligan, William Standring
description: UK Deputy Prime Minister David Lammy sought to calm concern about disagreements with the US after Donald Trump’s tirade against Britain’s approach to climate and immigration.
title: UK’s Lammy Downplays Tensions With US After Trump’s UN Tirade

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Russia plans to run a budget deficit for a fifth year as declining revenue and increased spending continue to put pressure on the government’s finances amid the Kremlin’s war on Ukraine.
title: Russia Plans ‘Acceptable’ 2026 Budget Deficit Amid War Spending

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called on the world leaders to support Moldova in the face of Russia’s alleged attempts to influence its parliamentary election on Sunday.
title: Zelenskiy Says Europe Can’t Lose Moldova to Russian Meddling

author: Alex Wickham
description: Andy Burnham, the Greater Manchester Mayor who is widely seen as a potential rival to UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer, used an interview with the magazine of the political left to argue Britain needs more radical policies.
title: Starmer’s Labour Rival Burnham Pitches More Radical UK Vision

author: Daniel Flatley, John Harney
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expressed disappointment that Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell hasn’t clearly established an agenda for cutting interest rates.
title: Bessent Chides Powell for Not Championing Interest Rate Cuts

author: Fred Ojambo
description: Uganda’s main opposition leader, Robert Kyagulanyi, has been cleared to challenge President Yoweri Museveni, who’s ruled the East African nation for four decades.
title: Uganda’s Bobi Wine Cleared to Challenge Museveni in Election

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Tariffs, aid cuts and visa limits under Donald Trump’s foreign policy are eroding US influence in Southeast Asia, where China is increasingly seen as dominant, the Sydney-based Lowy Institute said in a report.
title: Trump Seen Weakening US Clout in China’s Backyard, Report Warns

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s new Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul and his cabinet were sworn into office on Wednesday, paving the way for the country’s third administration in two years to outline its policy agenda before fresh elections are called in the coming months.
title: Thailand’s Third Government in Two Years Sworn In After Turmoil

author: William Horobin
description: France’s labor unions called for a new round of anti-austerity protests on Oct. 2, saying Prime Minster Sebastien Lecornu didn’t offer clarity on concessions he’s willing to make in a new budget.
title: French Unions Plan More Strikes Saying No Clarity on Budget Plan

author: Daniel Flatley, Patrick Gillespie
description: The US is discussing a $20 billion swap line with Argentina and is ready to buy up the country’s dollar bonds, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said, giving President Javier Milei “a bridge” until key midterm elections next month.
title: Bessent Says US Negotiating $20 Billion Swap Line With Argentina

author: Chloe Meley
description: The political crisis enveloping France risks crimping off revenue at defense contractors Thales SA and Dassault Aviation SA, as budget delays threaten a much-touted increase in military spending.
title: French Political Turmoil Casts Doubt on Thales, Dassault Outlook

author: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu
description: Romania secured initial European Union backing for a revised deficit-reduction plan that would entail a wider budget gap of 8.4% of economic output this year, according to people familiar with the talks.
title: Romania Gets EU Nod for Higher Deficit Amid Budget Struggles

author: Carolina Gonzalez
description: Chile’s congress is doubling down on plans to compel everyone to vote in this year’s presidential election, imposing a fine on people who fail to do so. That’s good news for ultra-conservative candidate Jose Antonio Kast.
title: Chile Mandatory Vote Aids Conservative, But Risks Creating Upset

author: Wojciech Moskwa
description: Poland’s zloty dropped to the weakest level this month after US President Donald Trump said NATO nations should shoot down Russian aircraft that violate their airspace, raising risks of a major escalation in the region.
title: Zloty Slumps as Trump Backs Use of Force Against Russian Jets

author: Frank Jomo
description: Malawian President Lazarus Chakwera conceded defeat in the nation’s elections, after partial results showed rival candidate and former leader Peter Mutharika is on course to win the vote.
title: Malawian Leader Concedes Defeat in Presidential Election

author: Michael Nienaber
description: NATO allies are struggling to coordinate a response to Russian airspace violations, with partners in the defense alliance openly contradicting each other.
title: NATO Allies at Odds Over How to Respond to Russia’s Threats

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: The president’s UN speech made for uncomfortable listening for some world leaders, but can’t easily be shrugged off.
title: Trump and the Symbolism of a Broken UN Escalator

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: Philippine government spending may slow amid ongoing probes into alleged corruption in flood-control projects, according to Budget Secretary Amenah Pangandaman.
title: Philippines Sees Corruption Crackdown Slowing State Spending

author: Thomas Gualtieri
description: A military airplane transporting Spanish defense Minister Margarita Robles suffered a GPS attack when it was traveling to Lithuania.
title: Spanish Defense Minister’s Plane Hit by GPS Interference

author: Patrick Sykes, Tugce Ozsoy
description: Turkish stocks rebounded after the Supreme Election Council ruled that the main opposition party can go ahead with its congress to choose the new leadership for its Istanbul branch. The decision came after an extraordinary meeting of the council, called in response to a court order suspending Wednesday’s congress.
title: Turkey Election Board Lets Opposition Vote Proceed, Stocks Rise

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Republican-controlled Senate panel that authorizes defense spending wants the Pentagon’s embattled test office to oversee an assessment of the Trump adminstration’s ambitious Golden Dome missile shield.
title: Senate Panel Wants Embattled Test Office To Evaluate Golden Dome

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union’s trade chief, Maros Sefcovic, will meet with US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer this week to try and restart stalled talks to lower tariffs on steel and aluminum exports.
title: EU Makes Fresh Push With US to Revive Talks on Metals Tariffs

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Russia plans to raise its consumption tax and broaden the base of companies required to pay it to help plug a widening fiscal gap as the war on Ukraine continues to weigh on the budget.
title: Russia Plans Tax Increase to Ease War-Related Strains on Budget

author: Toru Fujioka, Erica Yokoyama
description: A top contender vying to lead the ruling Liberal Democratic Party sought to distance herself from dovish remarks made a year ago, saying the Bank of Japan should decide the particulars of monetary policy.
title: Takaichi Says BOJ Should Decide Policy Steps, Softening Stance

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana, Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Thailand’s exports grew at the slowest pace in almost a year as US tariff impact began hurting demand for it products, with officials warning that shipments are set to further lose momentum in the coming months.
title: Thai Exports Set to Lose Momentum as US Tariff Begins to Bite

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: Even as his country still has no government, Emmanuel Macron is making his pitch to Wall Street: Invest in France — every democracy has its ups and downs.
title: Macron Courts Wall Street Leaders, Pitching French Stability

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: IAEA head Rafael Mariano Grossi is first to declare his candidacy for secretary-general and he’s using his clout to win over Washington.
title: Nuclear Chief Pursues Trump’s MAGA Support for UN Top Job

author: Alicia Diaz
description: Democrat Adelita Grijalva won the special election for Arizona’s seventh district, The Associated Press projected, further narrowing the already razor-thin Republican majority in the US House while setting the stage for a forced floor vote to release government files on Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Democrat Wins Arizona House Seat, Setting Up Epstein Vote

author: Chris Palmeri
description: Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel took a conciliatory tone in his return to TV Tuesday night, according to three people who attended the taping of his ABC show.
title: Kimmel Takes a Conciliatory Tone on Return to His ABC Show

author: Magdalena Del Valle, Myles Miller
description: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday there were two things he got from the United Nations: “a bad escalator and a bad teleprompter.”
title: Trump’s Viral UN Escalator Mishap Draws Investigations, Suspicion

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Josh Wingrove, Magdalena Del Valle
description: President Donald Trump had barely arrived at the United Nations Tuesday when the mishaps began. First an escalator ground to a halt right as First Lady Melania Trump stepped onto it. Then, as the president took the stage to address delegates at the UN headquarters, he complained his teleprompter broke.
title: Trump’s Amped Up Second Term on Full Display in Fiery UN Speech

author: Martin Ritchie
description: MP Materials Corp., the US rare earths producer that’s received government investment to support construction of domestic capacity, is warning the unprecedented move won’t be easily repeated for other companies.
title: US Rare Earths Champion Says Pentagon Deal Not Easily Replicable
